programmes.show_description: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis laugh at nearly-recent news with guests Maisie Adam, Rhys James, Milton Jones, Emily Lloyd-Saini and Glenn Moore.
Lies, damned lies and celebrities! Richard Madeley, Sanjeev Bhaskar, Kate Humble and Miles Jupp join David Mitchell, Lee Mack and Rob Brydon for the bluff-filled comedy quiz.
Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are Rylan Clark-Neal, Sara Pascoe, Mary Portas and Paul Sinha.
Seahorse: The guys begin a treacherous journey through the local jungle, tension sizzles between Lawrence and Aaron, and a mysterious new figure arrives asking searching questions.
Needles: Joel hurries to complete Jesus' mission, Gus and Cobi deal with the authorities, and all of the guys make one last attempt to escape Belize once and for all.
Shopping from Home.
Shopping from Home.

programmes.show_name: James May: My Sisters' Top Toys
programmes.show_description: James May reveals how he was stuck between his older and younger sisters as a child - and that most of his toys were their hand-me-downs - as he rediscovers classic family toys.
Picnics: The bikers explore our national love of picnics, celebrating classics such as the Cornish pasty and the Scotch egg, and baking a luxurious Dundee cake.
Rick continues his journey in the old camper van eastwards towards the Mediterranean, sampling great dishes and good hospitality along the way.
Automotive antics with Clarkson and the team. Jeremy and James May show off the ageing but massive luxury cars that they bought for the price of a new Ford Mondeo.
Jeremy Clarkson and his fellow motor obsessives go Deutsch as they take on their rivals from the show's German equivalent, and James May tries out a very strange Japanese car.
Ethiopia: Comedians Hugh Dennis and David Baddiel are shaking to their funny bones as they drive 2,000km along Ethiopia's bumpy roads in a quest to find the Ark of the Covenant!
Madagascar: Celebs take on treacherous tracks. Angus Deayton and Mariella Frostrup battle across broken bridges as they drive up Madagascar's eastern coast on roads mired in mud.
Paul Merton and Suki Webster arrive in Canterbury to pick up their cruiser and set off on their first-ever staycation on wheels touring Kent's coastline.
Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are Olivia Colman, Aston Merrygold, Jon Richardson and Michaela Strachan.
Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are Prue Leith, Scarlett Moffatt, Big Narstie and Tomasz Schafernaker.
Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are Jo Brand, Emma Bunton, Jonnie Peacock and Shaun Williamson.
Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are Daisy May Cooper, Diane Morgan, Richard Osman and Rory Reid.
Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show - joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are Rhod Gilbert, Ronan Keating, Ellie Taylor and Georgia Toffolo.
Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show - joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are Stacey Dooley, Alex Jones, Rachel Parris and Henning Wehn.
Comedians Babatunde Aleshe and Jo Caulfield, radio presenter Richie Anderson, and the legendary Carol Smillie enter Richard's den of quiz for this edition.
Comedians Babatunde Aleshe and Jo Caulfield, radio presenter Richie Anderson, and the legendary Carol Smillie enter Richard's den of quiz for this edition.
Comedians Babatunde Aleshe and Jo Caulfield, radio presenter Richie Anderson, and the legendary Carol Smillie enter Richard's den of quiz for this edition.
A Room with an Alan: Steve Coogan plays Norwich's finest. Armed with programme ideas and a clump of cheese, Alan meets a BBC commissioner.
Alan Attraction: Steve Coogan's comedy classic. Alan has failed to get a second TV series and is days away from bankruptcy. Meanwhile, he has fallen in love.
Watership Alan: Steve Coogan's comedy classic. Alan gets in an udder state when he insults Norfolk's farmers on his radio show and makes a promotional film.
Romance: Lee Mack's Rose d'Or-winning comedy returns - and it's now a family sitcom, as Lee and Lucy have three kids in tow. The married pair try to keep the romance alive.
Babysitting: Comedy great Bobby Ball returns in Lee Mack's puntastic sitcom. Lee's dad Frank babysits the kids, which Lucy regrets when young Benji repeats a swear word.
Car: Pun-lovers rejoice for the return of Lee Mack's hit sitcom. Lee hopes for a stress-free ferry trip to France, but when you've got kids, things tend not to go to plan...
Ruff & Reddy: Sandi Toksvig looks at ruffs and red things with Alan Davies, Tom Allen, Susan Calman and Zoe Lyons.
Lucy breaks into the big time after her BAFTA nomination as UKTV want a proper A-list comedy name on the couple's show and are ready to splash the cash, but Jon has other ideas.
Lucy has a nightmare on Bake Off and Gregg Wallace isn't having it, Jon has a real nightmare and Lucy makes the most of it, and UKTV want Jon and Gill to be their new star double act.
Lucy makes her mark on Taskmaster but finds out that Julian Clary is a dangerous man to know, and Jon helps Elsie win more house points but risks a sticky end to his meddling.
Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis feature in a special edition of the topical comedy show featuring fond favourites, outtakes, and other previously unseen bits.

programmes.show_name: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programmes.show_description: A Physically Large Head: Mirthful musings on life with the laptop-literate comedian. Dave ponders society's image obsession and investigates how far people will go for fame.
Perth: Auction experts compete for storage lots in the cut-throat reality show! The chance of winning a car in a blind auction drives Heavy D and the gang into a bidding frenzy.
Blackpool: Fast-talking auctioneer Sean Kelly brings his hugely popular show over the pond. The gang visit Blackpool, where Nat and John take a punt on a novel mode of transport.
Bob and Paul travel to the northern islands of Norway on an extreme fishing adventure as they face the mighty maelstrom where tides collide and big fish await.
Mountain Rescue Dog Handler: Guy loves dogs - he therefore jumps at the opportunity to become part of a dog mountain rescue team tackling dangerous terrain as a mountain rescue guide.
The team find out if you can grab a reliable used car for less than 500 pounds with the help of a tank assault course, and Chris lives the high life in Maserati's new MC20 supercar.
Freddie, Chris and Paddy celebrate 100 years of the BBC by tackling motorsport 1920s-style. Paddy delves into BMW's legendary M-cars, and Chris gets to grips with Ford's new WRC racer.
Comedians Jen Brister and Ian Moore, actor Kelvin Fletcher, and Dr Zoe Williams join the genial giant of quiz to test their general knowledge skills.
Comedians Jen Brister and Ian Moore, actor Kelvin Fletcher, and Dr Zoe Williams join the genial giant of quiz to test their general knowledge skills.
Breakfast: The Hairy Bikers look for great ways to kick start the day. They find out about how our morning meal has changed and evolved through the years.
Nation of Gardeners: The bikers celebrate British food. They head into the garden, where through good times and bad our skills have inspired amazing dishes.
Simon Reeve travels from the Peloponnese peninsula to the rugged and mountainous north of the country and learns how its people cope with seemingly never-ending crises.
Simon Reeve's journey around Turkey begins at Istanbul and the beaches of the Aegean Sea before ending up at the war-torn border with Syria.
Bob and Paul travel to the northern islands of Norway on an extreme fishing adventure as they face the mighty maelstrom where tides collide and big fish await.
Hobbies: Will and Ralf take hobby-hunting to extremes with ice-cold swims, full-frontal art classes, and cosplaying as cowboys in the most unlikely of places.

programmes.show_name: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programmes.show_description: New. Roy Wood Jr is host as comedian and actor Guz Khan - and broadcaster Kirsty Wark - join team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to delve into the news.

Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis feature in a special edition of the topical comedy show featuring fond favourites, outtakes, and other previously unseen bits.
Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis look back at some of the news from the recent past with guests Angela Barnes, Alasdair Beckett-King, Rhys James, Ria Lina and Josh Pugh.
